Authors: Heripracoyo S., Meilia F., Ronny C., Prasetyo U.E.
Title: Model of measuring the influence of Knowledge Management system to IT complaints, case study in telecomunication company
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Heripracoyo, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Meilia, F., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ronny, C., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Prasetyo, U.E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to investigate the best practices in the transdisciplinary field of knowledge management system implementation and measurement of IT Complain in a telecommunication company (PT Telkomsel). This paper examines three variables of Knowledge Management (People, Process and Technology) and IT Complain Variable. This research used two methods such as a qualitative and quantitative method. Qualitative methods of interviewing and observation and quantitative method by gave a questionnaire to respondent. As for analysis research used descriptive and verificative method. The goal of this research will be used to know how useful the role and influence of the knowledge management system for customer complaint. This paper is intended to provide a model to measure the effect of Knowledge Management to IT complain especially in Telecommunication Company. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Descriptive Analysis; IT Service Management Centre; Knowledge Management; observation; Verificative Analysis
Index Keywords: Information management; Knowledge based systems; Management science; Surveys; Technology transfer; Customer complaints; Descriptive analysis; IT service management; Knowledge management system; observation; Quantitative method; Telecommunication companies; Verificative Analysis; Knowledge management
References: Kraiger, K., Ford, J., Salas, E., Application of cognitive, skill-based, and affective theories of learning outcomes to new methods of training evaluation (1993) Journal of Applied Psychology, p. 28; Loudon, K.C., (2011) Management Information Systems: Managing the Digital Firm (12th Edition), , Prentice Hall; RingelBickelmaier, C., Ringel, M., Knowledge management in international organisations (2010) Journal of Knowledge Management; Shannak, O.R., Measuring Knowledge Management Performance (2009) European Journal of Scientific Research, 35 (2), pp. 242-253; Okkonen, J., (2004) The Use of Performance Measurement in Knowledge Work Context; Ong, C., Lai, J., Developing an instrument for measuring user satisfaction with knowledge management systems (2004) Proceedings of the 37th Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences
